summary: The document, part of the 2025 release under the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992, details confidential communications between the FBI and James Angleton of the CIA. It focuses on the exchange of sensitive information, stressing the importance of confidentiality and the non-attribution of information to the CIA to safeguard sources and methods. Additionally, it proposes a method for referencing Angleton in FBI reports without disclosing his CIA connection, aiming to protect the integrity of intelligence investigations.
key_findings: Confidential information exchange between FBI and CIA, specifically involving James Angleton.
Emphasis on protecting the source of information by not attributing it directly to the CIA.
Proposal to refer to Angleton as a Bureau informant in future communications to maintain confidentiality.
Discussion on the handling of information related to Israeli matters and the need for clearance with Angleton before dissemination.
